instruments.name: BioServe MiniSpin
instruments.operations: Crew time required + sample return required

instruments.size: 22.5 cm W × 24 cm D × 12 cm H
instruments.interface_definitions: 120 V AC power, manual front panel control
instruments.specimen_types_supported: Cells, microbes, small organisms, protein solutions
instruments.specimen_size_quantity: 12 × (0.2–2.0 ml) microcentrifuge tubes or 16 PCR tubes

instruments.name: BioLab (ESA Columbus)
instruments.operations: Crew time for loading + ground telescience
instruments.flight_heritage: Columbus module, ISS; launched 7 February 2008 (Space Shuttle Atlantis)
instruments.size: Rack-mounted in Columbus; two rotor platforms in incubator
instruments.payload_volume_required: Columbus rack; experiment containers / vials (ATV, Progress, commercial cargo)
instruments.centrifuge_performance: Two rotor platforms; 1 g simulated for gravity comparison with weightlessness
instruments.interface_definitions: Experiment containers; standard vials; MELFI storage interface
instruments.specimen_types_supported: Micro-organisms, cells, tissue cultures, small plants, small invertebrates
instruments.specimen_size_quantity: Standard experiment containers and vials; capacity per rotor platform

instruments.key_applications: Life science µg vs 1 g; video/microscope teleoperations
instruments.autonomy: Yes (automatic processing after crew initiation; ground teleoperations)

instruments.name: Cell Biology Experiment Facility (CBEF)
instruments.flight_heritage: JEM Pressurized Module (Kibo), ISS; launched 2008 (Space Shuttle)
instruments.size: Rack-mounted; incubator with µG and 1G compartments
instruments.power_average: TBD (per JEM rack); canister: DC +5 V, +12 V, ±15 V
instruments.centrifuge_performance: 0.1–2.0 G at 112.5 mm radius; 20–140 rpm (1 rpm steps)
instruments.interface_definitions: Standard medium canister (power, analog, video, command per JEM spec)

instruments.imaging: Video interface per standard JEM video specification

instruments.name: Rhodium Variable Gravity Simulator (RhVGS-01)
instruments.flight_heritage: ISS internal; DARPA Biomanufacturing missions (e.g., Summer 2024); 2024
instruments.payload_volume_required: Up to 36 samples per operational period
instruments.centrifuge_performance: Low-speed, high-throughput; Lunar, Martian, and Earth gravity simulation
instruments.interface_definitions: Proprietary QuIC Space Process™; industry-compatible quality assurances
instruments.specimen_size_quantity: Up to 36 samples; load/unload on orbit per operational period
instruments.experiment_duration: Mission-dependent; multiple gravity forces and time points supported
instruments.key_applications: Partial-g accuracy in µg; on-orbit sample exchange; high-throughput partial-g
